name: Kepler-327
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-327 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-327 is a star with 0.38999999999999974 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.49 times its radius. It is located 794.78 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-327 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-327 b

Kepler-327 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.03 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 2.55 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-327.

The mass of Kepler-327 b is 1.24 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-327 b is 1.11 that of Earth. At less than 1.5 Earth masses, Kepler-327 b is a regular terrestrial planet, much like the terrestrial planets we find in our solar system, namely Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars.

Kepler-327 c

Kepler-327 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 5.21 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-327.

The mass of Kepler-327 c is 1.04 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-327 c is 1.03 that of Earth. At less than 1.5 Earth masses, Kepler-327 c is a regular terrestrial planet, much like the terrestrial planets we find in our solar system, namely Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars.

Kepler-327 d

Kepler-327 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.09 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 13.97 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-327.

The mass of Kepler-327 d is 3.57 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-327 d is 1.73 that of Earth. At 3.57 Earth masses, Kepler-327 d is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-327, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
